Text: is this puto ruski or wot,like?
There is an english audio track too--read the info!

First thx for upload! Second I have a question: is there a way to preserve russian and english audio track or at least the english one when converting this file format to..MP4 ? I tried with 4videosoft MKV video converter but...the single audio track that the converter keeps it in the new file is the russian one ! I hate that... Can anyone help me with a suggestion please ?

prince__vlad, Google mkvmerge

That will let you strip-out the RUS soundtrack leaving the ENG, then hit it with your 4videosoft or other converter.
Oh, almost forgot, thanks GoodFilms (and seeders)!

@ numse: nope, they're not hardcoded, just embedded.  Turn 'em off in VLC, or, like mt_phile says, strip the subtitles and the Russian audio using mkvmerge.

@ GoodFilms: Thanks!
